Package eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.h2020.helios_social.core.contextualegonetwork.Context
  • public final class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a context of the Contextual Ego Network. The context stores all the information related to the nodes, i.e. the actors that engage in interactions inside it, and keeps track of its spatial and temporal characteristics. The context can be unloaded from memory using the cleanup() function and can be forced to be written anew in the device's storage by calling the removeFromStorage() method. If the context is unloaded from memory, references to it remain and its data are reloaded on the first demand or by calling load().

      void load()
      Loads the context from the given serializer in memory.
      Edge removeEdge​(Node src, Node dst)
      Removes an edge between a source and the destination node, and if either the source or the destination node is the ego the alter node is removed from the social graph too (because the condition for which a node belongs to the ego network, that is only if it is connected to the ego with an edge, isn't satisfied anymore)
      void removeFromStorage()
      Removes any local files used to store the context (but retains the context in memory) These files will be re-created once the context is saved again.
      void removeNode​(Node node)
      Removes a node and its edges from the context
      void removeWeakEdges​(double threshold)
      Removes all edges from the context if the tie strength is less than a threshold.
      boolean save()
      If the context is loaded, it is serialized to a file.

    • Method Detail

      • getContextualEgoNetwork

        public ContextualEgoNetwork getContextualEgoNetwork()
        Returns:
        The ContextualEgoNetwork in which the context resides

      • save

        public boolean save()
        If the context is loaded, it is serialized to a file. The context's nodes are not serialized though
        Returns:
        Whether the context was saved.

      • removeFromStorage

        public void removeFromStorage()
        Removes any local files used to store the context (but retains the context in memory) These files will be re-created once the context is saved again.

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Saves the context to a file and removes its data memory and it from the dynamic serializer (so that universal save does not save it anymore)
        See Also:
        save()

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the context from the given serializer in memory. This operation is automatically performed on-demand by other context access operations.

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Returns:
        Whether the context has been loaded in memory

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData()
        Returns:
        The data attached to the context

      • getRecurrencyArray

        public float[][] getRecurrencyArray()
        Extracts the percentage of days of the week and hours of the day in which the context has been active
        Returns:
        An array containing the weekly recurrencies rates

      • getTimeCounter

        public long[][] getTimeCounter()
        Returns:
        A mutable copy of the recurrencies array

      • getTotalHourActive

        public long getTotalHourActive()
        Returns:
        The total number of hours the context has been active

      • getNodes

      • addEdge

        public Edge addEdge​(Node src,
                    Node dst)
        Creates an edge between two nodes of the social graph
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dst - The destination node
        Returns:
        The created Edge
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src or dst are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dst are the same node or if they don't belong to the context
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the edge already exists in the context

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge​(Node src,
                    Node dst)
        Gets the edge (if it exists) between two nodes of the social graph
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dst - The destination node
        Returns:
        The edge if the source and the destination nodes are in the social graph and are connected by an edge, null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src and dest are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dest are the same node

      • getOrAddEdge

        public Edge getOrAddEdge​(Node src,
                         Node dst)
        Gets the edge (if it exists) between two nodes of the social graph or creates it if it doesn't exist
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dst - The destination node
        Returns:
        The found or created Edge
        See Also:
        getEdge(Node, Node), addEdge(Node, Node)

      • removeEdge

        public Edge removeEdge​(Node src,
                       Node dst)
        Removes an edge between a source and the destination node, and if either the source or the destination node is the ego the alter node is removed from the social graph too (because the condition for which a node belongs to the ego network, that is only if it is connected to the ego with an edge, isn't satisfied anymore)
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dst - The destination node
        Returns:
        The edge removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src and dst are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dst are the same node

      • addNode

        public void addNode​(Node node)
        Adds a node to the context.
        Parameters:
        newNode - The new node to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if newNode is null

      • addNodeIfNecessary

        public void addNodeIfNecessary​(Node node)
        Adds a node to the context. Does nothing if the node already exists in the context. Node can be created through the ContextualEgoNetwork.getOrCreateNode(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object) function.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if newNode is null

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode​(Node node)
        Removes a node and its edges from the context
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the node is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the node is the ego of not part of the context

      • getInEdges

        public java.util.stream.Stream<Edge> getInEdges​(Node node)
        Gets the in-going edges of a given node
        Parameters:
        node - The given node
        Returns:
        A stream of the incoming edges
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the node is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the node is not in the context

        public java.util.stream.Stream<Edge> getOutEdges​(Node node)

        Returns:

      • removeWeakEdges

        public void removeWeakEdges​(double threshold)
        Removes all edges from the context if the tie strength is less than a threshold.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The value that is compared to the tie strength
